data.title: Pierce Brosnan German voice Frank Glaubrecht
meta_keywords: native speakers voice over talents artists dubbing actors
data.meta_description: Pierce Brosnan German dubbing voice is Frank Glaubrecht. Book now the German voice over of Pierce Brosnan.
data.text:
Dubbing voice:

- Frank Glaubrecht

Pierce Brosnan & his dubbing voice Frank Glaubrecht

Profession: Actor, producer & painter

Birthday: 16.05.1953

Born in: Drogheda / Ireland

Nationality: Ireland & USA

Height: 186cm

Partner: Keely Shaye Brosnan

Ex-partner: Cassandra Harris

Miscellaneous:

Pierce Brendan Brosnan grew up in a simple family and discovered his interest in acting at an early age. He began his career in the theater and received initial recognition for his work in productions such as "Wait Until Dark" and "The Red Devil Battery Sign". His talent was quickly recognized and he was given the opportunity to star in television series such as "Remington Steele" (1982-1987), which brought him international fame.

He is actively involved in environmental causes and charities, including UNICEF and the Natural Resources Defense Council.

Breakthrough:

His breakthrough came with the role of secret agent James Bond. Brosnan took on the role of the famous British spy in the films "GoldenEye" (1995), "Tomorrow Never Dies" (1997), "The World Is Not Enough" (1999) and "Die Another Day" (2002). His charming charisma, sharp mind and elegant style made him one of the most popular Bond actors of all time.

Development:

He has appeared in films such as "Mamma Mia!" (2008), "The Thomas Crown Affair" (1999) and "The Matador" (2005). His ability to convince in both action films and romantic comedies has earned him a broad fan base.

In addition to his acting career, Pierce Brosnan is also active as a producer. He founded his own production company and was involved in films such as "The Matador" (2005) and "The November Man" (2014).

Accolades:

22 awards & 26 nominations

Brosnan has been nominated several times for the Saturn Award, which recognizes outstanding achievements in science fiction, fantasy and horror films. He received nominations for films such as "GoldenEye" (1995), "Tomorrow Never Dies" (1997) and "The World Is Not Enough" (1999). In 2003, Brosnan received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, recognizing his significant contributions to the film industry.

As a proud Irishman, Brosnan has been honored with awards from his homeland as well. He received the Irish Film and Television Academy Award for Best Actor for his role in "Evelyn" (2002) and an Honorary Lifetime Achievement Award in 2004.
